name: viciously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is cruel and shows an intention to hurt or upset someone: These articles viciously attack him as a man. His viciously funny play has become a modern classic.
in a violent way that causes great pain: He was viciously attacked and suffered head injuries. See
vicious
More examplesFewer examplesThe candidate viciously attacked his opponent in his speech.My family and I have been relentlessly and viciously harassed.Jimmy slapped the ball down viciously with his bat.He was viciously beaten about the head and chest and fell to the floor.The woman had been assaulted viciously.
